channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Cybercriminal Listings Target Fujitsu, Baxter Kelly, AGX Financeira, and a Belgian IT Platform
item.description: This article reports on several new listings for unauthorized access sales and data breaches affecting companies across Japan, the U.K., Brazil, and Belgium. The listings include sensitive internal files, Citrix access, customer data, and administrative control over a monitoring system, with prices ranging from $1,500 to $20,000.

item.title: ToolShell Campaign: New SharePoint Zero-Day (CVE-2025-53770) Triggers Widespread Exploitation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, None; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint, identified as CVE-2025-53770, is actively being exploited in targeted attacks. The vulnerability allows attackers to bypass authentication, gain remote code execution capabilities, and establish persistent access using stolen cryptographic keys.

item.title: PHP PDO Flaw Allows Attackers to Inject Malicious SQL Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PHP PDO; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability allows attackers to inject malicious SQL commands by exploiting weaknesses in PDO's SQL parser. This affects millions of web applications worldwide, even when developers implement prepared statements correctly. Attackers can manipulate PDO's parsing logic through carefully constructed payloads, leading to SQL injection.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: SharePoint 0-Day, Chrome Exploit, macOS Spyware, NVIDIA Toolkit RCE and More
item.description:
FYSA:
The provided article appears to be a summary of various cyber-related incidents, attacks, and trends from around the world. The article discusses malware families like Rainbow Hyena, DiskStation Security, and Katz Stealer; phishing campaigns targeting specific industries or organizations; and large-scale cyber thefts affecting financial institutions and other entities.
There are no explicit discussions about vulnerabilities in software, hardware, or firmware within this article. However, the article does touch upon various cybersecurity concerns and threats that could potentially impact different systems and organizations.

item.title: Over 1,000 CrushFTP servers exposed to ongoing hijack attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrushFTP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54309; Summary: All CrushFTP versions below 10.8.5 and 11.3.4_23 are vulnerable to hijack attacks that exploit a critical security bug due to mishandled AS2 validation, allowing admin access to the web interface.

item.title: Assessing the Role of AI in Zero Trust
item.description: The article discusses the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in Zero Trust architecture, highlighting its capabilities in adaptive trust, continuous risk evaluation, and automation. It also emphasizes the importance of human-machine teaming, where AI amplifies human decision-making rather than replacing it.

item.title: Surveillance Firm Exploits SS7 Flaw to Track User Locations
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SS7 (Signaling System No. 7) protocol; CVE(s): None; Summary: A sophisticated surveillance operation has been discovered exploiting critical vulnerabilities in the global telecommunications infrastructure to track mobile phone users' locations without authorization. The attack leverages weaknesses in the decades-old SS7 protocol that underpins international cellular networks, manipulating the TCAP layer and using an obscure encoding technique called "extended tag encoding" to disguise malicious location tracking requests.

item.title: Learn 14 Languages from Babbel with this exclusive StackSocial deal
item.description: The article is promoting language learning platforms Babbel, uTalk, and Rosetta Stone, offering lifetime subscriptions and discounts. It highlights the features of each platform, such as AI conversation partners and personalized review sessions. The article also includes a free board report deck for CISOs to present cloud security risks and priorities in business terms.

item.title: Dell confirms breach of test lab platform by World Leaks extortion group
item.description: World Leaks, a rebranded extortion gang, has breached Dell's product demonstration platform and is trying to extort the company into paying a ransom. The stolen data is believed to be synthetic test data used in product demonstrations and trials, with only a very outdated contact list being legitimate.

item.title: CoinDCX Hack Leads to $44.2 Million Loss
item.description: CoinDCX, an Indian cryptocurrency exchange, suffered a significant security breach that resulted in approximately $44 million in losses. Despite the incident, customer funds remain secure and unaffected, thanks to the company's segregated account architecture. The investigation is ongoing to identify vulnerabilities, implement additional safety measures, and trace the movement of compromised funds.

item.title: CVE‑2025‑37103: Remote Access Risk in Aruba Instant On Access Points Due to Hardcoded Passwords
item.description: Vulnerable Product: HPE Aruba Instant On Access Points; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37103, CVE-2025-37102; Summary: The Aruba Instant On access points contain a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-37103) that allows remote access to the device's web interface without authentication due to a hardcoded admin password. This flaw can be exploited to gain administrative access and launch lateral attacks across the internal network, and when combined with CVE-2025-37102, it enables command injection and remote command execution.

item.title: CVE-2025-54309: New CrushFTP Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrushFTP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54309; Summary: A zero-day vulnerability in CrushFTP allows attackers to gain administrator-level access through the HTTPS interface on unpatched servers, enabling file theft, privilege escalation, and deeper network compromise. The flaw affects versions prior to 10.8.5 and 11.3.4_23, and building released after July 1, 2025, contain the fix.

item.title: Microsoft AppLocker Flaw Lets Malicious Apps Bypass Security Restrictions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft AppLocker; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability in Microsoft's AppLocker security feature allows malicious applications to bypass established security restrictions by exploiting a seemingly minor error in the MaximumFileVersion field. Attackers could potentially modify a blocked executable's version number to exceed the configured maximum version, but this would simultaneously break the file's digital signature, making it detectable by systems configured with "signed executables only" policies.

item.title: Livewire Flaw Puts Millions of Laravel Apps at Risk of RCE Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Livewire; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54068; Summary: A critical remote command execution vulnerability exists in Livewire versions from 3.0.0-beta.1 to 3.6.3, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the server by injecting malicious code through property updates. Exploitation requires only a vulnerable component with default configuration, and no user authentication or interaction is necessary.

item.title: CISA Issues Alert on Microsoft SharePoint 0-Day RCE Exploited in Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint Server allows unauthorized attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely over a network, potentially giving cybercriminals complete control over affected systems. The flaw stems from deserialization of untrusted data and is actively being exploited in cyberattacks.

item.title: 7-Zip Vulnerability Lets Malicious RAR5 Files Crash Systems
item.description: Vulnerable Product: 7-Zip; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53816; Summary: A critical denial-of-service vulnerability in 7-Zip's RAR5 decoder allows attackers to crash systems by processing specially crafted RAR5 archive files, leading to memory corruption and system crashes. The vulnerability occurs due to a heap buffer overflow when the decoder attempts to repair corrupted archive items, resulting in writing data beyond allocated buffer boundaries.

item.title: PoisonSeed Hackers Bypass FIDO Keys Using QR Phishing and Cross-Device Sign-In Abuse
item.description: A novel attack technique has been disclosed, allowing threat actors to downgrade Fast IDentity Online (FIDO) key protections by deceiving users into approving authentication requests from spoofed company login portals. The attack exploits a legitimate FIDO feature called cross-device sign-in and does not exploit any flaw in the FIDO implementation.

item.title: PoisonSeed Attack Tricks Users into Scanning Malicious MFA QR Codes
item.description: The PoisonSeed threat group has developed an attack technique that exploits FIDO key cross-device sign-in features, bypassing multifactor authentication (MFA) and allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access to protected accounts through social engineering tactics.

item.title: SharePoint 0-Day RCE Flaw Actively Exploited for Full Server Takeover
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704; Summary: A new SharePoint vulnerability (CVE-2025-53770) is being actively exploited in large-scale attacks worldwide, enabling attackers to gain complete control of on-premise servers without authentication. The exploit chain, dubbed "ToolShell," leverages previously demonstrated Pwn2Own vulnerabilities to achieve remote code execution and steals cryptographic secrets from SharePoint servers.

item.title: CrushFTP 0-Day Vulnerability Actively Exploited to Breach Servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrushFTP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54309; Summary: A zero-day vulnerability in CrushFTP servers is being actively exploited by threat actors to compromise systems worldwide. The vulnerability allows attackers to exploit a previously patched issue that remained present in outdated installations, making it critical for organizations to maintain current software versions and implement recommended security measures.

item.title: Microsoft releases emergency patches for SharePoint RCE flaws exploited in attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-53771; Summary: Two zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771) were exploited in "ToolShell" attacks to achieve remote code execution on Microsoft SharePoint servers worldwide. The flaws bypassed previous patches and impacted over 54 organizations. Emergency updates have been released for Microsoft SharePoint Subscription Edition, SharePoint 2019, and are still being worked on for SharePoint 2016.

item.title: Microsoft Releases Urgent Patch for SharePoint RCE Flaw Exploited in Ongoing Cyber Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-53771; Summary: The exploited vulnerability (CVE-2025-53770) is a remote code execution flaw that arises from the deserialization of untrusted data in on-premise versions of Microsoft SharePoint Server. The newly disclosed spoofing flaw (CVE-2025-53771) allows an authorized attacker to perform spoofing over a network. These flaws are related to two other SharePoint vulnerabilities, and the exploit chain has been patched as part of Microsoft's July 2025 Patch Tuesday update.

item.title: Hard-Coded Credentials Found in HPE Instant On Devices Allow Admin Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE) Instant On Access Points; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37103, CVE-2025-37102; Summary: The HPE Instant On Access Points have a critical security flaw that allows an attacker to bypass authentication and gain administrative access. Additionally, there is an authenticated command injection flaw in the command-line interface that could be exploited with elevated permissions to run arbitrary commands.

item.title: 3,500 Websites Hijacked to Secretly Mine Crypto Using Stealth JavaScript and WebSocket Tactics
item.description:
A new attack campaign has compromised over 3,500 websites worldwide with JavaScript cryptocurrency miners, using obfuscated JavaScript, WebSockets, and infrastructure reuse to stay hidden. The malware assesses device capabilities, spawns background Web Workers for mining tasks, and dynamically adjusts mining intensity based on device power without raising alarms.
FYSA: Threat actors are leveraging browser-based cryptojacking attacks, exploiting JavaScript embeds, Google OAuth endpoints, WordPress databases, and plugins to compromise websites and inject malicious code. They use stealthy miners, obfuscation, and infrastructure reuse to stay hidden, prioritizing persistence over resource theft.

item.title: EncryptHub Targets Web3 Developers Using Fake AI Platforms to Deploy Fickle Stealer Malware
item.description: EncryptHub (aka LARVA-208 and Water Gamayun), a financially motivated threat actor, has been attributed to a new campaign targeting Web3 developers with information stealer malware. The attackers use fake AI platforms and trick victims into clicking on meeting links, which ultimately lead to the download of malicious software disguised as a genuine Realtek HD Audio Driver.

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint zero-day exploited in RCE attacks, no patch available
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint (CVE-2025-53770) is being actively exploited since July 18th, allowing attackers to steal the MachineKey configuration and inject malicious code. The vulnerability has been chained with two other flaws (CVE-2025-49706 and CVE-2025-49704) to achieve remote code execution. A security update will be released as soon as possible.

item.title: HPE warns of hardcoded passwords in Aruba access points
item.description: Vulnerable Product: HPE Aruba Instant On Access Points; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37103, None; Summary: Hardcoded login credentials in Aruba Instant On Access Points allow attackers to bypass normal device authentication and access the web interface, enabling administrative access. This vulnerability can be exploited by remote attackers to change settings, install backdoors, capture traffic, or perform lateral movement.

item.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability, CVE-2025-53770 “ToolShell,” to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770; Summary: The vulnerability, a remote code execution issue, has been added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog due to active exploitation. It poses significant risks to the federal enterprise and should be remediated by affected organizations as soon as possible.

item.title: Microsoft Releases Guidance on Exploitation of SharePoint Vulnerability (CVE-2025-53770)
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-49706; Summary: A remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in on-premise SharePoint servers enables unauthorized access and allows malicious actors to execute code over the network. The vulnerability is actively being exploited and poses a risk to organizations.

item.title: Critical Unpatched SharePoint Zero-Day Actively Exploited, Breaches 75+ Global Organizations
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, None; Summary: A zero-day flaw in Microsoft SharePoint Server tracked as CVE-2025-53770 (CVSS score: 9.8) allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over a network through deserialization of untrusted data. The vulnerability is being exploited in a large-scale campaign and has been linked to the previously disclosed CVE-2025-49706.

item.title: Malware Injected into 6 npm Packages After Maintainer Tokens Stolen in Phishing Attack
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm packages; CVE(s): None; Summary: A supply chain attack targeted popular npm packages via a phishing campaign designed to steal project maintainers' npm tokens. The captured tokens were used to publish malicious versions of the packages, attempting to execute a DLL on Windows machines and potentially allowing remote code execution.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Critical CrushFTP Flaw to Gain Admin Access on Unpatched Servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrushFTP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54309; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to obtain admin access via HTTPS due to mishandled AS2 validation in CrushFTP 10 before 10.8.5 and 11 before 11.3.4_23, when the DMZ proxy feature is not used. This critical flaw has been actively exploited in the wild since July 18, 2025.

item.title: Threat actors downgrade FIDO2 MFA auth in PoisonSeed phishing attack
item.description: The PoisonSeed threat actors are bypassing FIDO2 security key protections by abusing the cross-device sign-in feature in WebAuthn to trick users into approving login authentication requests from fake company portals. This attack does not exploit a flaw in FIDO2's implementation but rather uses a legitimate feature that downgrades the FIDO key authentication process. The threat actors can initiate a login flow that relies on cross-device authentication instead of the user's physical FIDO2 key, effectively bypassing security key protections.

item.title: Popular npm linter packages hijacked via phishing to drop malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm package eslint-config-prettier; CVE(s): None; Summary: The npm package eslint-config-prettier was compromised after its maintainer fell victim to a phishing attack, allowing the attacker to publish malicious versions of the package that can infect Windows machines. The affected versions are 8.10.1, 9.1.1, 10.1.6, and 10.1.7.

item.title: ChatGPT"s GPT-5-reasoning-alpha model spotted ahead of launch
item.description: The article discusses the upcoming release of OpenAI's GPT-5 model, which may unify breakthroughs from previous models. Additionally, leaks suggest that a new "o3-alpha" model may be released, featuring improved coding and frontend design capabilities. There is no mention of vulnerabilities or cybersecurity threats in this article.

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google may disrupt education market with new AI tools
item.description: AI companies like OpenAI and Anthropic are developing new AI-based learning tools for students, such as Study Together features that guide the learning process. Google is also testing a similar feature called Guided Learning for Gemini. These tools aim to aid in student learning and potentially disrupt the online education market.

item.title: New CrushFTP zero-day exploited in attacks to hijack servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrushFTP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54309; Summary: A zero-day vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-54309 allows attackers to gain administrative access via the web interface on vulnerable servers. The vulnerability affects versions prior to CrushFTP v10.8.5 and v11.3.4_23, which were released around July 1st.

item.title: Arch Linux pulls AUR packages that installed Chaos RAT malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Arch User Repository (AUR); CVE(s): None; Summary: The AUR was compromised when a malicious user uploaded three packages containing the CHAOS remote access trojan (RAT). The packages were designed to install the malware on Linux devices, which can be used for cryptocurrency mining, credential harvesting, or cyber espionage.

item.title: Chinese Threat Actors Operate 2,800 Malicious Domains to Distribute Windows Malware
item.description: A sophisticated threat actor, known as "SilverFox," has been conducting a large-scale malware distribution campaign since at least June 2023, targeting Chinese-speaking individuals and entities. The campaign employs various tactics such as fake application download sites, spurious update prompts, and phishing emails to deliver Windows-specific malware designed for credential theft, financial exploitation, and potential access brokering.

item.title: New Veeam-Themed Phishing Attack Uses Weaponized WAV File to Target Users
item.description:
Cybercriminals are using voicemail notifications to distribute malware by impersonating Veeam Software. The attack begins with an email containing a WAV file that, upon playback, reveals a scripted call attempting to create urgency around license expiration. The real danger lies in the weaponized nature of the WAV file itself, which can be embedded with malicious code exploiting vulnerabilities in media players or audio processing libraries.
(Note: Since there is no specific vulnerability mentioned, I've summarized the article as a non-vulnerability related cybersecurity content)

item.title: UK ties GRU to stealthy Microsoft 365 credential-stealing malware
item.description: The Authentic Antics espionage malware attacks are attributed to APT28 (Fancy Bear), a threat actor linked to Russia's military intelligence service (GRU). The malware steals credentials and OAuth 2.0 tokens, allowing access to victim email accounts, and sends stolen data to an attacker-controlled email address using the victim's own Outlook account.

item.title: Microsoft mistakenly tags Windows Firewall error log bug as fixed
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: A bug in the Windows Firewall With Advanced Security logs an error message as event ID 2042 every time the device is restarted, but Microsoft states it's not an issue with the Windows Firewall and can be disregarded. The bug was mistakenly marked as fixed in recent updates, and a fix will be released in an upcoming update.

item.title: Lumma Infostealer Steals Browser Data and Sells It as Logs on Underground Markets
item.description: This article discusses infostealers, specifically the Lumma malware variant, which steals sensitive data from compromised systems. It spreads through phishing operations, social engineering tactics, and malvertising, and is attributed to the Russian-based threat actor Shamel. The malware's ecosystem has been disrupted by a coordinated international effort, but new C2 servers have reemerged, indicating ongoing threat persistence.

item.title: Phishers have found a way to downgrade—not bypass—FIDO MFA
item.description: An attacker downgraded FIDO MFA to a weaker form of authentication. The attack is classified as a FIDO downgrade attack, not a bypass, and requires intentional configuration by an admin to fall back to the weaker method.

item.title: New ChatGPT o3-alpha model hints at coding upgrade
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: The article mentions OpenAI's o3-alpha model, which features significant coding-related improvements and is capable of designing web pages and creating simple web games. It also hints at the upcoming GPT-5 model, which is expected to unify breakthroughs from different models.

item.title: New Surge of Crypto-Jacking Hits Over 3,500 Websites
item.description: The article describes a campaign that infected over 3,500 websites with JavaScript miners, using advanced obfuscation and low-profile execution to evade detection. The miners employ Web Workers to execute mining logic off the main thread, minimizing performance impacts and avoiding traditional red flags like excessive CPU usage or overt network activity.

item.title: China's Massistant Tool Secretly Extracts SMS, GPS Data, and Images From Confiscated Phones
item.description: Massistant is a mobile forensics tool used by law enforcement authorities in China to gather information from seized mobile devices. It requires physical access to the device and can collect data such as GPS location, SMS messages, images, audio, contacts, and phone services.

item.title: Fancy Bear Hackers Target Governments and Military Entities with Advanced Tools
item.description: The article discusses Fancy Bear, a sophisticated Russian cyberespionage collective that has been operational since 2007. They exploit vulnerabilities in office suites, operating systems, and web applications to gain access to targeted organizations. Their tactics include phishing, spearphishing, exploitation of public-facing applications, and command execution.

item.title: UNG0002 Group Hits China, Hong Kong, Pakistan Using LNK Files and RATs in Twin Campaigns
item.description: The article describes a threat activity cluster tracked as UNG0002 (Unknown Group 0002), which has been targeting multiple sectors in China, Hong Kong, and Pakistan. The group uses shortcut files, VBScript, and post-exploitation tools like Cobalt Strike and Metasploit to launch cyber espionage campaigns.

item.title: Russian alcohol retailer WineLab closes stores after ransomware attack
item.description: WineLab, a retail store of the largest alcohol company in Russia, has closed its stores following a cyberattack that is impacting its operations and causing purchase problems to its customers. The attackers requested a ransom payment, but the company declined to engage and won't comply with their demands.

item.title: Ivanti Zero-Days Exploited to Drop MDifyLoader and Launch In-Memory Cobalt Strike Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS) appliances; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-22457; Summary: The vulnerabilities in ICS appliances have been weaponized to drop MDifyLoader, which is used to launch Cobalt Strike in memory. The attacks exploit a critical security flaw (CVE-2025-0282) and a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2025-22457) that were previously patched by Ivanti in January 2025 and April 2025, respectively.

item.title: Snake Keylogger Bypasses Windows Defender and Uses Scheduled Tasks to Steal Credentials
item.description: A sophisticated phishing operation impersonates Turkish Aerospace Industries (TUSAŞ) to attack Turkish businesses in the defense and aerospace sectors. The campaign distributes malicious emails containing a PE32 executable that delivers a variant of the Snake Keylogger, an information-stealing malware designed to harvest sensitive data.

item.title: New Phobos ransomware decryptor lets victims recover files for free
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Phobos and 8Base Ransomware; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses the release of a free decryptor by the Japanese police for victims of the Phobos and 8Base ransomware operations. The decryptor can recover files encrypted by these operations, including those with extensions such as ".phobos", ".8base", ".elbie", ".faust", and ".LIZARD".

item.title: Hackers scanning for TeleMessage Signal clone flaw exposing passwords
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TeleMessage SGNL; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48927, CVE-2025-48928; Summary: The TeleMessage SGNL app allows retrieving usernames, passwords, and other sensitive data due to the exposure of the '/heapdump' endpoint from Spring Boot Actuator without authentication. This vulnerability (CVE-2025-48927) lets an attacker download a full Java heap memory dump, which may contain plaintext usernames, passwords, tokens, and other sensitive data.

item.title: Deep Web vs Dark Web: What’s the Real Difference?
item.description: The article explains the difference between the deep web and the dark web. While both are non-indexed by search engines, the deep web is a larger part of the internet that includes private content accessible through standard browsers, whereas the dark web is a smaller subset that uses encryption to maintain anonymity and often hosts illegal or malicious activities.

item.title: New QR Code Attacks Through PDFs Bypass Detection and Steal Credentials
item.description: The article discusses an ongoing phishing campaign called "Scanception" that uses QR code-based delivery mechanisms to distribute credential-harvesting URLs. The campaign involves targeted emails with PDF lures, social engineering tactics, and abuse of trusted services to evade detection.

item.title: Sophos Intercept X for Windows Flaws Enable Arbitrary Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Sophos; CVE(s): CVE-2024-13972, CVE-2025-7433, CVE-2025-7472; Summary: Three critical security vulnerabilities were discovered in Sophos Intercept X for Windows, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code and gain system-level privileges. The vulnerabilities affect different components of the software, including the updater, Device Encryption module, and installer.

item.title: Google Sues BadBox 2.0 Botnet Operators Behind 10 Million+ Infected Devices
item.description: The article discusses the BadBox 2.0 botnet, a network of over 10 million insecure devices running Android Open Source Project (AOSP) that were compromised by malware during manufacturing and used for ad fraud schemes and other illicit activities.

item.title: Grafana Flaws Allow User Redirection and Code Execution in Dashboards
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Grafana; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6023, CVE-2025-6197; Summary: Two critical vulnerabilities were discovered in Grafana's scripted dashboards and organization switching functionality. The first vulnerability is a high-severity cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw that can redirect users to malicious websites and execute arbitrary code, while the second is a medium-severity open redirect flaw that requires specific conditions for exploitation.

item.title: Ubiquiti UniFi Vulnerability Lets Hackers Inject Malicious Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ubiquiti UniFi Access devices; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27212; Summary: The vulnerability allows malicious actors to inject and execute arbitrary commands on affected systems due to improper input validation within certain UniFi Access devices, carrying a maximum CVSS score of 9.8. It can be exploited by attackers with access to the UniFi Access management network, enabling them to bypass normal security controls and potentially gain unauthorized access to sensitive areas or systems.

item.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 Gets Enhanced Threat Dashboard
item.description: Microsoft has introduced a new customer-facing dashboard for its email security platform, providing detailed visibility into threat protection effectiveness across organizations. The enhanced dashboard and two comparative benchmarking reports aim to empower organizations with actionable data about their security posture and foster trust through transparency in threat protection capabilities. The initiative recognizes the importance of continuous evaluation of security solutions in today's sophisticated threat landscape.

item.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25257; Summary: The vulnerability, an SQL injection flaw, has been added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog due to active exploitation. It poses significant risks to the federal enterprise and requires timely remediation to protect against cyber threats.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: CrazyHunter Ransomware
item.description: The article discusses the "CrazyHunter" ransomware group, which has been targeting Taiwanese organizations, particularly in the healthcare and technology sectors. The group uses advanced tactics, techniques, and tools (TTPs) such as BYOVD, SharpGPOAbuse, and Prince Ransomware builder to carry out sophisticated attacks.

item.title: CERT-UA Discovers LAMEHUG Malware Linked to APT28, Using LLM for Phishing Campaign
item.description: This article reports on a phishing campaign that delivered a malware codenamed LAMEHUG, attributed with medium confidence to the Russian state-sponsored hacking group tracked asAPT28. The malware uses a large language model (LLM) to generate commands based on textual representation, and supports commands to harvest basic information about the compromised host and search for specific files.

item.title: Google Sues 25 Chinese Entities Over BADBOX 2.0 Botnet Affecting 10M Android Devices
item.description: This article does not discuss a vulnerability. Instead, it reports on Google's legal action against 25 unnamed individuals or entities in China for allegedly operating the BADBOX 2.0 botnet and residential proxy infrastructure, which compromises over 10 million Android devices running open-source software. The botnet is used to conduct large-scale ad fraud and other digital crimes.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit Ivanti Connect Secure Flaws to Deploy Cobalt Strike Beacon
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Connect Secure; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-22457; Summary: Threat actors are exploiting vulnerabilities in Ivanti Connect Secure to deploy advanced malware, including MDifyLoader and Cobalt Strike Beacon. The attacks use DLL hijacking and side-loading to inject malware into memory, and employ obfuscation and encryption to evade detection.

item.title: Critical NVIDIA Container Toolkit Flaw Allows Privilege Escalation on AI Cloud Services
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Container Toolkit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23266; Summary: The NVIDIA Container Toolkit contains a critical container escape vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-23266, which carries a CVSS score of 9.0 out of 10.0. An attacker could execute arbitrary code with elevated permissions, potentially leading to escalation of privileges, data tampering, information disclosure, and denial-of-service. The vulnerability affects all versions up to and including 1.17.7 and has been addressed in versions 1.17.8 and later.

item.title: From Backup to Cyber Resilience: Why IT Leaders Must Rethink Backup in the Age of Ransomware
item.description: The article discusses the importance of maintaining operations during an incident, especially in light of escalating IT outages and ransomware attacks. It highlights the limitations of traditional backup strategies, which often rely on manual testing and may not account for targeted cyberattacks that aim to destroy recovery infrastructure. The article emphasizes the need for a "resilience-first" approach, which integrates immutable backups, automated testing, and orchestrated recovery playbooks to ensure business continuity even during an attack.

item.title: Hackers Exploit ClickFix Tactics to Spread NetSupport RAT, Latrodectus, and Lumma Stealer
item.description: Attackers are using the ClickFix social engineering technique to distribute malware families like NetSupport RAT, Latrodectus, and Lumma Stealer. This technique tricks users into executing malicious commands by hijacking their clipboard and injecting obfuscated PowerShell scripts or commands that victims unwittingly paste into system interfaces.

item.title: Lenovo Protection Driver Flaw Enables Privilege Escalation and Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Lenovo; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4657; Summary: Lenovo's protection driver software contains a buffer overflow vulnerability that allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges, posing significant security risks. The flaw affects Lenovo PC Manager, Lenovo Browser, and Lenovo App Store versions prior to 5.1.110.4231, impacting millions of users worldwide.

item.title: OpenAI: GPT-5 is coming, "we'll see" if it creates a shockwave
item.description: OpenAI's next AI model, GPT-5, is still in development and no release date has been announced. Additionally, the company is planning to upgrade its Operator tool and adding new features to its Image Gen model, including a built-in style feature on ChatGPT. There are also hints about an Operator-like tool being tested on ChatGPT ahead of GPT-5's launch.

item.title: Microsoft Uncovers Scattered Spider Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures in Recent Attacks
item.description: This article discusses the tactics and techniques used by a financially motivated cybercriminal group called Octo Tempest (Scattered Spider, Muddled Libra, UNC3944, or 0ktapus). The group uses advanced social engineering campaigns, phishing attacks, and exploitation of Azure Active Directory environments to gain initial access and pivot to cloud resources.

item.title: WAFFLED: New Technique Targets Web Application Firewall Weaknesses
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various WAF platforms (AWS WAF, Azure WAF, Google Cloud Armor, Cloudflare, and ModSecurity); CVE(s): None; Summary: The WAFFLED attack technique exploits parsing discrepancies in Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) to bypass security measures and compromise the security of millions of websites worldwide. The technique targets three content types (multipart/form-data, application/json, and application/xml) and affects five major WAF platforms.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit GitHub Accounts to Host Payloads, Tools, and Amadey Malware Plugins
item.description: This article discusses a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operation that employed the Amadey botnet to distribute various payloads. The operation exploited fake GitHub accounts as open directories, bypassing web filtering mechanisms and simplifying distribution.

item.title: Russian Vodka Maker Beluga Struck by Ransomware Attack
item.description: Novabev Group, the parent company of Beluga vodka, was hit by a sophisticated ransomware attack on July 14, 2025, causing temporary disruptions to its IT infrastructure and services. The company refused to pay any ransom demands and is working to restore normal operations with the help of external cybersecurity experts.

item.title: ‘Daemon Ex Plist’ Vulnerability Grants Root Access on macOS
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-27981; Summary: A newly discovered vulnerability in macOS allows attackers to escalate privileges from standard user to root access by exploiting a timing flaw in how the operating system handles daemon configuration files. The vulnerability requires no initial elevated permissions and can be exploited through simple XML modifications, giving attackers complete system control, including disabling System Integrity Protection (SIP), manipulating privacy databases, and installing persistent backdoors.

item.title: CISA Publishes 13 ICS Security Advisories on Critical Flaws
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released thirteen Industrial Control Systems (ICS) security advisories highlighting critical vulnerabilities in operational technology networks across multiple sectors. The advisories warn of potential disruptions to essential infrastructure services, emphasizing the importance of immediate action to prevent exploitation by threat actors.

item.title: 10 Best XDR (Extended Detection And Response) Solutions 2025
item.description:
FYSA:
The article presents an analysis of top 10 Extended Detection and Response (XDR) solutions in the market. The review highlights the strengths and approaches of each solution, including their ability to integrate with existing security stacks, detect advanced threats, and streamline incident response.
The XDR solutions reviewed are:
1. Google Chronicle Security Operations 2. Exabeam Fusion XDR 3. Fortinet FortiXDR 4. Sophos XDR 5. Mandiant Security Operations (part of Google Chronicle) 6. Microsoft Azure Sentinel 7. Palo Alto Networks XDR 8. FireEye Helix XDR 9. RSA NetWitness XDR 10. CrowdStrike Falcon XDR
The analysis notes that each solution has its unique strengths and weaknesses, making it essential for organizations to carefully evaluate their specific needs and requirements before selecting an XDR solution.
Overall, the article provides valuable insights into the current state of XDR solutions in the market and highlights the importance of choosing a suitable solution to effectively detect and respond to advanced threats.

item.title: Signal App Clone Telemessage App Vulnerability Actively Exploited for Password Theft
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TeleMessageTM SGNL; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48927; Summary: A critical vulnerability in TeleMessageTM SGNL's legacy configuration of Spring Boot Actuator allows threat actors to steal passwords and sensitive data by exploiting a publicly accessible diagnostic endpoint. The vulnerability affects certain deployments of the secure communications archiving system and has been actively exploited since at least May 5, 2025.

item.title: BIND 9 Vulnerabilities Enable Cache Poisoning and Service Disruption
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Internet Systems Consortium (ISC) BIND 9; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40776, CVE-2025-40777; Summary: Two critical security vulnerabilities in BIND 9, one allowing cache poisoning attacks and the other causing assertion failures leading to service disruption. These flaws primarily impact DNS resolvers rather than authoritative servers, with potential for redirecting users to malicious websites or intercepting communications.

item.title: Poor Passwords Tattle on AI Hiring Bot Maker Paradox.ai
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Paradox.ai; CVE(s): None; Summary: The personal information of millions of people who applied for jobs at McDonald's was exposed after researchers guessed the password ("123456") for Paradox.ai's account. The weak password allowed access to 64 million records, including applicants' names, email addresses, and phone numbers.
FYSA: Threat actors exploited a Paradox.ai administrator in Vietnam's malware-infected device, stealing usernames and passwords for various internal and third-party services.

item.title: Citrix Bleed 2 exploited weeks before PoCs as Citrix denied attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix NetScaler; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5777; Summary: A critical memory overread vulnerability, dubbed "CitrixBleed 2," allows attackers to send malformed POST requests and leak 127 bytes of memory. The flaw can be exploited to expose sensitive data, hijack sessions, and gain unauthorized access to internal resources.

item.title: GitHub abused to distribute payloads on behalf of malware-as-a-service
item.description: The article discusses a malicious activity campaign called Amadey, which is likely part of a larger Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operation. Threat actors behind Amadey are distributing various malware families from fake GitHub repositories onto infected hosts, suggesting they may be serving payloads for other individuals or groups.

item.title: VMware fixes four ESXi zero-day bugs exploited at Pwn2Own Berlin
item.description: Vulnerable Product: VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion, and Tools; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41236, CVE-2025-41237, CVE-2025-41238, CVE-2025-41239; Summary: Three of the patched flaws allow programs running in a guest virtual machine to execute commands on the host, while the fourth is an information disclosure. The first three have a severity rating of 9.3 and were exploited as zero-days during Pwn2Own Berlin 2025.

item.title: Microsoft Teams voice calls abused to push Matanbuchus malware
item.description: The Matanbuchus malware loader is being distributed through social engineering over Microsoft Teams calls impersonating IT helpdesk, allowing attackers to gain initial access and deliver malicious payloads. The latest version, Matanbuchus 3.0, includes enhanced evasion, obfuscation, and post-compromise capabilities, making it a sophisticated threat.

item.title: ZDI-25-616: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer CATPRODUCT File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6971; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of CATPRODUCT files.

item.title: ZDI-25-617: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer CATPRODUCT File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6972; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer by parsing CATPRODUCT files without validating the existence of an object. User interaction is required, and an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-618: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer JT File Parsing Uninitialized Variable Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6974; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations, requiring user interaction. It exists within the parsing of JT files due to uninitialized memory access. An attacker can leverage this to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-619: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer JT File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0831; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations by parsing out-of-bounds read. User interaction is required, and the issue results from lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-620: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer JT File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6973; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer by parsing JT files without validating the existence of an object. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-611: VMware ESXi VMCI Uninitialized Memory Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: VMware ESXi; CVE(s): CVE-2025-41239; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of VMware ESXi. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the implementation of VMCI due to uninitialized memory prior to access.

item.title: ZDI-25-612: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server Hard-coded Credentials Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37105; Summary: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the hsqldb service, which listens on TCP port 9001 by default, due to hard-coded credentials.

item.title: ZDI-25-613: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server Hard-coded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37106; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information or edit configuration on affected installations of Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server without requiring authentication. The specific flaw exists within the web service, which listens on TCP port 5814 by default, due to hard-coded credentials.

item.title: ZDI-25-614: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37107; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of the Hewlett Packard Enterprise AutoPass License Server, making an authorization decision based on a non-canonical URL. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability, and it exists within the web service that listens on TCP port 5814 by default.

item.title: ZDI-25-615: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer IPT File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7042; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations by parsing IPT files without validating the existence of an object. User interaction is required, and an attacker can leverage this to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: Google sues to disrupt BadBox 2.0 botnet infecting 10 million devices
item.description: The article discusses a lawsuit filed by Google against the operators of the Android BadBox 2.0 malware botnet, which has infected over 10 million devices and is conducting global ad fraud schemes against Google's advertising platforms. The botnet uses infected Android Open Source Project (AOSP) devices, including smart TVs, streaming boxes, and other connected devices that lack security protections.

item.title: ZDI-25-604: Cisco Identity Services Engine disableStrongSwanTunnel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20283; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Cisco Identity Services Engine, requiring authentication. The issue is due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the iseadminportal user.

item.title: ZDI-25-605: Cisco Identity Services Engine IpAccessFilter Direct Request Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20285; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass IP restrictions on affected installations of Cisco Identity Services Engine. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the issue results from an incomplete Spring Boot filter mapping in the web.xml file.

item.title: ZDI-25-606: Cisco Identity Services Engine handleStrongSwanTunnelStatus Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20284; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Cisco Identity Services Engine. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the flaw exists within the implementation of the handleStrongSwanTunnelStatus method due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in deserialization of untrusted data.

item.title: ZDI-25-607: Cisco Identity Services Engine enableStrongSwanTunnel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20337; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without authentication, due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data in the enableStrongSwanTunnel method. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the iseadminportal user.

item.title: ZDI-25-608: Cisco Identity Services Engine handleFilesUpload Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20282; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Cisco Identity Services Engine without authentication. The issue occurs due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, allowing the upload of arbitrary files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the iseadminportal user.

item.title: ZDI-25-609: Cisco Identity Services Engine invokeStrongSwanShellScript Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20281; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Cisco Identity Services Engine without authentication. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call, allowing an attacker to execute code in the context of root.

item.title: ZDI-25-610: Linux Kernel ksmbd destroy_previous_session Null Pointer Dereference Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux Kernel; CVE(s): CVE-2025-38191; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of the Linux Kernel without authentication. The issue is due to a lack of proper validation of a pointer prior to accessing it in the destroy_previous_session function, which can be exploited to cause a denial-of-service condition on the system.

item.title: LameHug malware uses AI LLM to craft Windows data-theft commands in real-time
item.description: LameHug is a novel malware family that uses a large language model (LLM) to generate commands for execution on compromised Windows systems. It relies on the Hugging Face API and an open-source LLM designed specifically for generating code, reasoning, and follow coding-focused instructions. The malware is written in Python and has been attributed to Russian state-backed threat group APT28.

item.title: This is your sign to step away from the keyboard
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: The article discusses the importance of self-care and stress management for cybersecurity professionals, highlighting the risks of burnout and the need to prioritize mental health.
FYSA: A Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operation was identified by Cisco Talos that used Emmenhtal loader and Amadey malware to deliver malicious payloads targeting Ukrainian entities via public GitHub repositories. The operation shows how easily adversaries can use trusted platforms like GitHub to deliver malware, making it more difficult for organizations to detect and block threats.
Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb; CVE(s): 2025-25257; Summary: A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit allows unauthenticated attackers to execute remote code by writing malicious files to the server's filesystem, potentially leading to full remote code execution.

item.title: Hackers Use GitHub Repositories to Host Amadey Malware and Data Stealers, Bypassing Filters
item.description: Threat actors are using public GitHub repositories to host malicious payloads and distribute them via Amadey as part of a campaign observed in April 2025. The malware loader Emmenhtal delivers Amadey, which downloads various custom payloads from public GitHub repositories operated by the threat actors.

item.title: Hacker steals $27 million in BigONE exchange crypto breach
item.description:
This article does not discuss a vulnerability. Instead, it reports on a cryptocurrency exchange hack that resulted in the theft of digital assets valued at $27 million. The article also discusses broader trends and statistics related to cryptocurrency crime.
FYSA: The article highlights a significant cryptocurrency heist, with hackers stealing $223 million worth of Cetus Protocol cryptocurrency. Additionally, it notes that there has been an increase in attacks on personal wallets, accounting for 23.35% of all stolen funds this year.

item.title: Chinese hackers breached National Guard to steal network configurations
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171, CVE-2023-20198, CVE-2023-20273, CVE-2024-3400; Summary: Salt Typhoon, a Chinese state-sponsored hacking group, exploited vulnerabilities in Cisco routers and other devices to breach a US Army National Guard network for nine months, stealing configuration files and administrator credentials. The vulnerabilities included a critical flaw in Cisco IOS and IOS XE Smart Install (CVE-2018-0171), a zero-day affecting Cisco IOS XE web UI (CVE-2023-20198), a privilege escalation flaw targeting IOS XE (CVE-2023-20273), and a command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks' PAN-OS GlobalProtect (CVE-2024-3400).

item.title: Max severity Cisco ISE bug allows pre-auth command execution, patch now
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Cisco's Identity Services Engine (ISE); CVE(s): CVE-2025-20337; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Cisco's ISE allows an unauthenticated attacker to store malicious files, execute arbitrary code, or gain root privileges on vulnerable devices. The issue is caused by insufficient user-supplied input validation checks and received the maximum severity rating of 10 out of 10.
FYSA: Although no exploitation of the three maximum severity vulnerabilities has been observed in the wild as of yet, it is recommended that system administrators take immediate action to mitigate the risks.

item.title: Microsoft Teams Exploited to Deliver Matanbuchus Ransomware Payload
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Teams; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes a sophisticated cyberattack campaign targeting organizations through Microsoft Teams impersonation. Attackers compromise systems by pretending to be IT helpdesk personnel during external Teams calls, leading to the execution of malicious scripts that deploy the Matanbuchus 3.0 malware loader.

item.title: Ukrainian Hackers Claim Cyberattack on Major Russian Drone Supplier
item.description: The article describes the story of a Ukrainian woman, Nelya Leonidova, who survived a cluster munition attack in 2014 and has been dealing with the long-term consequences of her severe combat-related injuries. The story highlights the humanitarian impact of explosive ordnance use in populated areas and emphasizes individual resilience in the face of catastrophic trauma.

item.title: H2Miner Targets Linux, Windows, and Containers to Illicitly Mine Monero
item.description: This article reports on a sophisticated cryptomining campaign called H2Miner, which targets Linux, Windows, and containerized environments simultaneously. The campaign uses updated scripts and infrastructure to deploy Kinsing malware, disable security defenses, and download additional payloads, including miners and information stealers.

item.title: Massistant: Chinese Mobile Forensic Tool Accesses SMS, Images, Audio, and GPS Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Meiya Pico's Massistant; CVE(s): None; Summary: Massistant is a sophisticated mobile forensics application deployed by Chinese law enforcement to extract comprehensive data from confiscated mobile devices. It can bypass device security measures and collect sensitive information, raising critical security concerns for international business travelers and enterprise organizations.

item.title: CVE-2025-25257: Attackers Exploit FortiWeb SQL Injection Bug for Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25257; Summary: A critical SQL injection vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) in Fortinet's FortiWeb Fabric Connector allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands and Remote Code Execution (RCE). The flaw impacts several FortiWeb versions, including 7.0.0 through 7.6.3, and has been actively exploited since July 11.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Apache HTTP Server Flaw to Deploy Linuxsys Cryptocurrency Miner
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Apache HTTP Server; CVE(s): CVE-2021-41773; Summary: The vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.49 is a high-severity path traversal vulnerability that could result in remote code execution, exploited by threat actors to deliver a cryptocurrency miner called Linuxsys.
FYSA: Threat actors have been conducting a long-term campaign, exploiting known security flaws and employing consistent techniques such as n-day exploitation, staging content on compromised hosts, and coin mining on victim machines. The campaign has resulted in the delivery of malware, including the Linuxsys cryptocurrency miner.

item.title: SquareX Collaborates With Top Fortune 500 CISOs To Launch The Browser Security Field Manual At Black Hat
item.description: The article announces the official launch of "The Browser Security Field Manual" by SquareX, a comprehensive guide to browser security threats and tactics. The manual features industry perspectives from leading CISOs and covers five major threat vectors, including phishing, malicious extensions, data loss, identity attacks, and browser-native ransomware.

item.title: Chinese State-Sponsored Hackers Target Semiconductor Industry with Weaponized Cobalt Strike
item.description: This article reports on a sophisticated cyberespionage campaign targeting Taiwan's semiconductor industry. Three Chinese state-sponsored threat actors (UNK_FistBump, UNK_DropPitch, and UNK_SparkyCarp) conducted coordinated phishing operations against organizations in the semiconductor sector, using various tactics, techniques, and procedures to deliver malware payloads and collect intelligence.

item.title: Over 4 Million Exposed Devices Used in Two New DoS Attack Campaigns
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various tunneling protocols (IPIP, GRE, 4in6, 6in4); CVE(s): CVE-2024-7595, CVE-2024-7596, CVE-2025-23018, and CVE-2025-23019; Summary: The vulnerability affects millions of Internet hosts that accept unauthenticated tunneling traffic, allowing for devastating denial-of-service attacks, including TuTL and Ping-Pong amplification attacks. Additionally, the EDoS attack targets cloud-hosted services by forcing vulnerable hosts to generate massive amounts of outbound traffic, leading to increased costs or service disruptions.

item.title: Cisco ISE Hit by CVSS 10 RCE Vulnerabilities Allowing Full System Takeover – Patch Now
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE), Cisco Unified Intelligence Center, and Cisco Prime Infrastructure; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20281, CVE-2025-20282, CVE-2025-20337; Summary: Three critical vulnerabilities with a maximum CVSS score of 10.0 allow unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems with root privileges by sending specially crafted API requests. The flaws exist in specific APIs within Cisco ISE and its Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC).

item.title: Researchers Reveal How Hacktivist Groups Gain Attention and Choose Their Targets
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have released findings on the operational dynamics of hacktivist organizations, revealing sophisticated attention-seeking behaviors and strategic target selection methodologies. The study highlights hacktivists' calculated targeting strategies, self-promotion mechanisms, and use of psychological warfare approaches to amplify their perceived influence. It also notes the commercialization trend within the hacktivist community and the increasing focus on capability development, leading to a more complex threat landscape.

item.title: CISA Releases Three Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: CISA issued three Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on July 17, 2025, providing information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. The advisories aim to inform users and administrators of technical details and mitigations for the affected products.

item.title: Panoramic Corporation Digital Imaging Software
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Panoramic Corporation Digital Imaging Software (Version 9.1.2.7600); CVE(s): CVE-2024-22774; Summary: The Digital Imaging Software is vulnerable to DLL hijacking, allowing an attacker with standard user privileges to obtain NT Authority/SYSTEM privileges. Successful exploitation could allow a standard user to gain elevated access.

item.title: Leviton AcquiSuite and Energy Monitoring Hub
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Leviton AcquiSuite and Leviton Energy Monitoring Hub; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6185; Summary: The vulnerability is a cross-site scripting (XSS) weakness that allows an attacker to craft malicious payloads in URL parameters, execute them in a client browser, steal session tokens, and control the service. Exploitation can occur remotely with low attack complexity.

item.title: UNG0002 Actors Weaponize LNK Files via ClickFix Fake CAPTCHA Pages
item.description: The article reports on a sophisticated espionage group known as UNG0002 (Unknown Group 0002) that has been conducting persistent campaigns across multiple Asian jurisdictions since May 2024. The group uses social engineering techniques, advanced malware deployment methods, and custom-developed implants to target organizations in China, Hong Kong, and Pakistan.

item.title: UK’s Co-op Retailer Hit by Cyberattack, 6.5 Million Members’ Data Exposed
item.description: The UK's Co-op retailer suffered a significant cyberattack in April 2024, resulting in the theft of personal data from all 6.5 million members. While no financial information was compromised, hackers accessed names, addresses, and contact information. The breach highlights the ongoing cybersecurity challenges facing major retailers and the importance of robust preventive measures.

item.title: Europol Disrupts NoName057(16) Hacktivist Group Linked to DDoS Attacks Against Ukraine
item.description: The article discusses an international operation led by Europol to disrupt the infrastructure of a pro-Russian hacktivist group called NoName057(16) that has been linked to DDoS attacks against Ukraine and its allies. The joint effort resulted in the dismantling of the group's central server infrastructure, arrests, searches, and issuance of arrest warrants.

item.title: NVIDIA Container Toolkit Vulnerability Allows Privileged Code Execution by Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Container Toolkit and GPU Operator; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23266, CVE-2025-23267; Summary: The NVIDIA Container Toolkit and GPU Operator contain two critical vulnerabilities that allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges. The first vulnerability (CVE-2025-23266) has a CVSS score of 9.0, while the second (CVE-2025-23267) has a score of 8.5. These flaws enable privilege escalation, data tampering, information disclosure, and denial-of-service attacks in containerized environments.

item.title: 1-Click Oracle Cloud Code Editor RCE Flaw Allows Malicious File Upload to Shell
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Code Editor; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure's Code Editor enabled attackers to silently hijack victim Cloud Shell environments through a single malicious link, allowing for potential lateral movement across OCI services and compromise of integrated developer tools. The vulnerability stemmed from a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) weakness in the file upload mechanism, which was remediated by implementing additional CSRF protections requiring a custom HTTP header.

item.title: CTEM vs ASM vs Vulnerability Management: What Security Leaders Need to Know in 2025
item.description: The article discusses the importance of implementing Continuous Threat Exposure Management (CTEM) programs, which complement Vulnerability Management (VM) and Attack Surface Management (ASM). CTEM provides a systematic approach to discover, prioritize, validate, and respond to security exposures. The article also highlights the benefits of integrating VM, ASM, and penetration testing solutions into a unified interface to support a holistic CTEM program.

item.title: Iranian Threat Actors Use AI-Generated Emails to Target Cybersecurity Researchers and Academics
item.description: This article discusses Iranian state-backed Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) groups and their hacktivist allies' increased cyber operations following Israeli and American strikes on Iranian nuclear and military facilities. The article highlights the groups' tactics, including espionage, disruption, and psychological warfare, as well as their use of AI-enhanced phishing operations and industrial control system scanning.

item.title: MaaS operation using Emmenhtal and Amadey linked to threats against Ukrainian entities
item.description: A Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operation, dubbed "Amadey," has been identified by Cisco Talos. The operation uses fake GitHub accounts to host payloads and tools, allowing operators to deliver various malware families to infected hosts. This MaaS operation overlaps with a previous SmokeLoader phishing campaign targeting Ukrainian entities.

item.title: Hackers Use DNS Queries to Evade Defenses and Exfiltrate Data
item.description: DNS tunneling is a technique used by cybercriminals to bypass corporate security measures and steal sensitive data by encoding data within DNS queries and responses. The attack process begins when threat actors gain control of a domain name's authoritative name server, allowing them to conduct command-and-control (C2) operations and data exfiltration while remaining largely undetected.

item.title: Threat Actors Deploy 28+ Malicious Packages to Spread Protestware Scripts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Socket's Threat Research Team; CVE(s): None; Summary: A network of at least 28 malicious packages, including protestware scripts, was discovered in the npm supply chain. The protestware disrupts user interface interactions by disabling mouse events and initiating playback of the Ukrainian national anthem, affecting Russian-language users on specific domains. The vulnerability highlights the risks of code reuse in open-source repositories, where undisclosed payloads can cascade through dependencies, amplifying potential impacts on downstream applications.

item.title: Top 10 Stealer Logs
item.description:
The provided article is an analysis of infostealer malware and their associated logs in 2025. It does not discuss a specific vulnerability in software, hardware, or firmware.
The article provides an overview of various infostealer malware families, including Lumma, Vidar, RedLine, StealC, Raccoon Stealer, MetaStealer, Mystic Stealer, and Hawklog. Each section highlights the features, target range, and evasion techniques used by each malware family to steal sensitive data such as credentials, credit card numbers, and cryptocurrency wallet details.
The article also discusses the role of stealer logs in enabling ransomware attacks, account takeovers, and financial fraud. It emphasizes the importance of threat hunting and stealer log analysis for detecting early signs of compromise and reducing the time gap between initial breach detection.
No specific vulnerabilities are mentioned or analyzed in the article.

item.title: PyPI Blocks Inbox.ru Domains After 1,500+ Fake Package Uploads
item.description: PyPI blocked the inbox.ru email domain after a campaign created over 250 fraudulent accounts and uploaded more than 1,500 empty projects, causing confusion among end-users and straining resources. The incident highlights the delegated security model of PyPI's registration process and emphasizes the importance of user vigilance and advanced detection mechanisms to prevent future incursions.

item.title: Critical SharePoint RCE Vulnerability Exploited via Malicious XML in Web Part
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): None; Summary: A severe remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint allows attackers to execute arbitrary code through malicious XML content embedded within web parts. The vulnerability originates from the deserialization process of web part properties and can be exploited through multiple endpoints, including the _/vti_bin/webpartpages.asmx service using the ConvertWebPartFormat SOAP action.

item.title: Hackers Actively Exploited CitrixBleed 2 Flaw Ahead of PoC Disclosure
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5777; Summary: The CitrixBleed 2 vulnerability was exploited by threat actors nearly two weeks before a public proof-of-concept was released, highlighting the sophistication of modern attack campaigns. Initial exploitation began on June 23, followed by the public release of a proof-of-concept on July 4, and GreyNoise's subsequent creation of a tracking tag on July 7. The vulnerability represents a significant security risk for organizations running Citrix NetScaler appliances.

item.title: Cisco Unified Intelligence Center Flaw Lets Remote Attackers Upload Arbitrary Files
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Unified Intelligence Center; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20274; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Cisco's Unified Intelligence Center allows authenticated remote attackers to upload arbitrary files, potentially enabling complete system compromise through privilege escalation to root access. The flaw stems from improper file validation and can be exploited by users with Report Designer role privileges, allowing for the execution of arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system.

item.title: Weaponizing SVG: How Threat Actors Embed Malicious JavaScript in Vector Files
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: Researchers have identified an emerging attack campaign using Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files to deliver JavaScript-based redirect attacks. The technique exploits the inherent trust in image formats, allowing malicious actors to embed obfuscated JavaScript within SVG files that execute automatically when opened in web browsers.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Target Taiwan's Semiconductor Sector with Cobalt Strike, Custom Backdoors
item.description: The article reports on spear-phishing campaigns conducted by three Chinese state-sponsored threat actors targeting the Taiwanese semiconductor industry. The campaigns involve phishing emails with malicious payloads, including Cobalt Strike or a custom backdoor, and DLL side-loading to spawn reverse shells and establish command-and-control connections.

item.title: 0-Day RCE Flaw in SonicWall SMA Devices Exploited to Launch OVERSTEP Ransomware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SonicWall; CVE(s): CVE-2024-38475, None; Summary: Threat actors are exploiting previously stolen credentials and a new rootkit called OVERSTEP to target end-of-life SonicWall Secure Mobile Access (SMA) 100 series appliances. The campaign represents a significant escalation in attacks against network infrastructure devices, as the threat actors are successfully compromising appliances even after organizations have applied the latest security updates.

item.title: Cloudflare Confirms BGP Hijack Behind 1.1.1.1 DNS Disruption
item.description: A global outage of Cloudflare's 1.1.1.1 DNS resolver service was caused by an internal configuration error rather than an external attack. The incident affected millions of users worldwide and coincided with an unrelated BGP hijack, which complicated the situation.

item.title: Europol Takes Down NoName057(16)’s Global Network of Over 100 Servers
item.description: Europol and Eurojust conducted Operation Eastwood to dismantle the NoName057(16) hacktivist collective's global infrastructure of over 100 servers worldwide. The operation resulted in two arrests, seven international arrest warrants, 24 house searches, and disruption of over 100 servers globally.

item.title: Cisco Warns of Critical ISE Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated Attackers to Execute Root Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco ISE and Cisco ISE-PIC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20337; Summary: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system with elevated privileges. It affects ISE and ISE-PIC releases 3.3 and 3.4, regardless of device configuration.

item.title: Submarine Cables Face Increasing Threats Amid Geopolitical Tensions and Limited Repair Capacity
item.description:
FYSA:
This analysis highlights various vulnerabilities in the submarine cable ecosystem, including:
1. **Concentration of cables at landing stations**: The clustering of multiple submarine cables at single landing sites increases the likelihood that damage to or near a landing site will impact multiple cables. 2. **Limited repair capacity**: Repair vessels are focused on laying new cable systems, constraining their ability to respond immediately to cable faults, leading to extended repair times. 3. **Regulatory hurdles**: Complex and lengthy permitting processes for repair ships vary by national territory, prolonging repair timelines and exacerbating the impact of limited repair capacity.
These vulnerabilities can have significant consequences for global internet connectivity, highlighting the need for investments in streamlining repair processes and expanding cable ship repair capacity to mitigate potential disruptions.

item.title: Co-op confirms data of 6.5 million members stolen in cyberattack
item.description:
A massive cyberattack on UK retailer Co-op resulted in the theft of personal data for 6.5 million members. The attackers accessed and stole Windows domain's Windows NTDS.dit file, which contains password hashes for Windows accounts.
FYSA: Threat actors associated with Scattered Spider were behind the Co-op cyberattack, as well as other attacks on M&S, Harrods, and MGM Resorts.

item.title: U.S. Army soldier pleads guilty to extorting 10 tech, telecom firms
item.description: A 21-year-old former U.S. Army soldier pleaded guilty to charges of hacking and extorting at least ten telecommunications and technology companies in the country. The man, Cameron John Wagenius, used online accounts associated with the nickname “kiberphant0m” and conspired with others to defraud victim organizations by obtaining login credentials for their protected computer networks.

item.title: Google finds custom backdoor being installed on SonicWall network devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): 2024-38475; Summary: UNC6148 exploited vulnerabilities in SMA appliances, gaining local administrator credentials and valid session tokens. They may have used infostealer logs or credential marketplaces to obtain credentials. A reverse shell was installed, providing a web interface for running commands and installing Overstep. The motivations of the group and what they do after Overstep is installed are unknown.

item.title: Cracked Apps Delivering Infostealers Identified as Leading Attack Vector in June 2025
item.description: The article discusses infostealer malware masquerading as keygens and cracked software, which uses advanced SEO poisoning to elevate malicious distribution sites in search results. It highlights the diversity of infostealers, including variants like LummaC2, Rhadamanthys, ACRStealer, Vidar, and StealC, and notes their evolving sophistication through techniques like evasion, deception, and anti-analysis mechanisms.

item.title: Hackers Leverage 607 Malicious Domains to Spread APK Malware with Remote Command Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): Janus vulnerability on Android versions 5.0 through 8.0 (None); Summary: Rogue domains were used in a large-scale phishing campaign to spread fake Telegram Messenger application files (APKs) over the course of a month, leveraging QR codes and centralized redirection for efficient malware delivery.
